summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and Amazon.com, Inc. legal counsel regarding a subpoena (reference CRIM1071168) issued to Amazon, likely as part of the Epstein investigation. The email includes scheduling of a call and an attached subpoena document.

persons.name: Ben Langner
persons.role: Senior Corporate Counsel, Government & Regulatory Litigation at Amazon.com, Inc.
persons.context: Amazon legal counsel coordinating with federal prosecutors regarding a subpoena. He is scheduling a call to discuss the subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Goldberg
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the prosecutor, involved in previous discussions about the Amazon subpoena.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the SDNY following up on a subpoena (CRIM1071168) issued to Amazon, seeking to ask additional questions and schedule a call.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with Amazon's corporate counsel regarding a subpoena as part of an investigation.
Prosecutor reaching out to legal counsel (likely at Amazon) who had previously been contacted about the subpoena.
Both are legal counsel at Amazon.com, Inc. copied on the same email thread regarding the subpoena.

events.title: Call regarding Amazon subpoena
events.description: A call took place between the prosecutor and Ben Langner to discuss the subpoena issued to Amazon.

events.title: Previous discussions about Amazon subpoena
events.description: The prosecutor's colleagues previously spoke with Amazon counsel about subpoena reference CRIM1071168.

locations: Seattle, WA 98121 (Amazon.com, Inc. office at 2021 7th Avenue)
New York, New York 10007 (Southern District of New York office at 1 Saint Andrews Plaza)
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to Amazon.com, Inc. with reference number CRIM1071168, likely related to the Epstein investigation.
Amazon's legal counsel (Ben Langner and Jeffrey Goldberg) were in communication with federal prosecutors regarding this subpoena.
The document is an email thread from September 2021, showing ongoing investigative activity years after Epstein's death.
The subpoena attachment is titled '2021.09.27_Court_Subpoenas_Amazon.pdf', indicating it is a court-issued subpoena.
The prosecutor is seeking additional information and a follow-up call regarding the subpoena originally discussed the previous year.
